Articles.Content: I will download it and have a look, but it will be installed as a separate installation. I am still able to play all the versions of KSP that have come since I started playing, as they have all been installed separately. It was quite a while before I switched from 0.24 to 0.90, as 0.90 killed so many of my craft due to the big change in aero parts in that particular release.
For kraken's sake yes!

Oh yes! As soon as I can. Will retain my 0.90 install and copy my main 'anomaly exploration' save over to check for changes to the ones I found. But will most likely start from scratch with a new one, after playing with the new parts and features in sandbox.
I will just update it and wait till my essential mods update (which I assume won't take too long) before playing a new career.

Yes i will be updating, looking forward to trying out the new aero, since i've never used far or anything like that. With rebalancing it will be like its all new and shiny ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I'll be able to retest stuff, see how things work and what doesn't. In a few words, I will be able to truely experiment again with the rocket parts, than almost instinctively knowing what will happen. New Fresh Kerbal smell.
Heck yeah I'll be updating. No mission could possibly get in the way of the most exciting release in KSP history.
I've already deleted all my stuff in 0.90. No regreets
The question is not will I be but When? And the answer is: as soon as squad server allows it.![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

I am even thinking about going an a new easter-egg hunt and updating my Thread from scratch.

Oh so much yes! I just hope the [GreenPower Electric Challenge](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114562-GreenPower-Electric-Challenge-Now-with-Badge) doesnt get destroyed. That will be the first thing I test run when 1.0 comes out. I will download 1.0 at 5 o clock in the morning (When I wake up).

Considering the ONLY mods that i run DMP and Hedit aside are visual, im updating teh second it hits, but im still gonna keep 0.90 around as its quite possible that much of my craft will nolonger be feaseable (im never giving up on my Tri-Fighters or some of my better capital ships). Basically the differences between 0.90 and previous versions (like 2.23 ect) are not all that much at the core, aerodynamics is the same, and aside from extra parts, nothing massively changed between part performance, ect.

1.0 (hopefully) will be the final major change, and subsequent updates will mostly add parts, fix balance, add features, ect, but wont do any major changes to how stuff flies, how heat works, ect. Hopefully after 1.0 there wont be much craft breakage, and stuff will remain functional afterwards.

That said, i still hope 1.0 doesnt break everything (especially non atmospheric craft), as id HATE to loose my capital ships with their insane armor (50t heavy ship got rammed by a 500t rocket at 300m/s and i survbived it with engines and weapons intact!).
I absolutely need zitronen to update KSPserialIO first, as my rig depends upon it. Otherwise, here we go.
I have a few things to finish on 0.90, so I probably won't update straight away. When I do, it will be starting from scratch in a new save.
